job_description:
• Associate’s degree (AAS or AS) in Information Technology Management, Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or Supply Chain Management.
• Or equivalent military/trade school experience.
• Complete all required safety training, conduct audits and walkthroughs, and ensure adherence to established safety and quality protocols to maintain a safe work environment.
• Utilize Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, OneNote, Excel) to efficiently complete tasks and support operational needs.
• 2+ years’ experience identifying performance gaps and implementing strategic improvements.
• 2+ years of industry experience or equivalent military training.
• Willingness to return to on-site work as needed.
• Availability to work Monday through Friday (8 AM – 5 PM) with flexibility for overtime, global meetings, and on-call rotation.

• Minimum QualificationsExcellent C and C++ programming skills, experience with software debuggers (e.
• GDB, LLDB), compilers and linkersSolid understanding of storage specific data structures, operating systems internals, storage performance evaluationGenuine passion for file systems technology, data security, privacy, and strong commitment towards developing testability, reliabilityBachelors in Computer Science/Electrical Engineering or equivalent experience/skills.
